learningPlan.title: Learning Plan
learningPlan.shortdesc: Learning plan for an introduction to the Bibliographic Framework Initiative (BIBFRAME).

lcPlanTitle.p: Lesson 6, Topic 1: Introduction to the Bibliographic Framework Initiative (BIBFRAME)

lcPlanSubject.title: Focus
lcPlanSubject.p: This lesson will focus on a basic introduction to the BIBFRAME model and its evolution.

lcPlanDescrip.title: Overview
lcPlanDescrip.p:
In this lesson, participants will gain familiarity with the basics of BIBFRAME and learn about the purpose and development of the initiative at the Library of Congress. After the introduction, there will be two hands-on activities:
In the first activity, they will use the categories developed in the preceding lesson and attempt to match them against classes and properties in BIBFRAME.
In the second activity, they will practice cataloging and explore workflows in MARVA, the Library of Congress BIBFRAME editor.

lcPlanPrereqs.title: Prerequisites
lcPlanPrereqs.p: As preparation for this lesson, participants will have developed a set of categories based on a card-sorting activity with MARC-based data.

lcInterventionItem.lcLearnStrat: Provide a high-level overview of BIBFRAME and discuss its development at the Library of Congress. Compare BIBFRAME to other standards, such as RDA, and discuss extension ontologies such as the Art and Rare Materials Ontology (ARM). Provide participants with a searchable searable version of the BIBFRAME 2.0 List View. Provide scaffolding for the participants to work in the MARVA environment.
lcInterventionItem.lcPlanObjective:
The goal of instruction is twofold:
For learners to gain a baseline familiarity with the BIBFRAME model, its characteristics, and its development at the Library of Congress.
To ensure that learners understand the purpose of the activity with MARVA and are prepareed for any challenges that may arise.
lcInterventionItem.lcAssessment: Check for comprehension before starting the activity.

lcInterventionItem.lcLearnStrat: While working with MARVA, participants will experiment with a split workflow in which some participants catalog at the Item- and Instance-level and others catalog at the Work- and Agent-level.
lcInterventionItem.lcPlanObjective: The activity is intended to expose learners to the MARVA editing environment and encourage them to reflect on the workflow and production impacts of BIBFRAME adoption.
lcInterventionItem.lcAssessment: The activity will be assessed through group discussion and reflection.
lcInterventionItem.lcDelivery: Participants will work in groups of four to five people. Groups will be given photocopies of an item for cataloging. Half the group will work with Item/Instance description and half with Work/Agent description.
